update.description:
As requested by pull request #54, I'm including the position of all individual markers in the message that the "bridge" generates.

I discovered a really interesting thing. If your motive configuration file has the streaming option enabled, when you call to TT_Update(), NPTrackingTools streams the data for you using the NatNet protocol (UDP multicast with the format that we already use). So, we don't need to create custom messages when using NPTrackingTools.dll .

I'm going to keep the OptiTrackBridge files for now because we have to do some latency tests but probably they will be removed in the future. We only need `windows/optitrackBridge.cc`.
update.title: Adding individual marker position to the optitrackBridge

pullrequest.title: Adding individual marker position to the optitrackBridge

content.raw:
these names or comments could be a little more informative. `RigidBody_A` is really a pose (position and orientation). The _A makes me think that RigidBody_A is an array of rigid bodies and Marker_A is an array of markers, which is untrue. Forgive me if this is a common convention.

I might suggest something like

RigidBody_A -> Pose_t
Marker_A -> Marker_t

while RigidBody_t and RigidBody_M can stay the same.
content.html:
these names or comments could be a little more informative. RigidBody_A is really a pose (position and orientation). The _A makes me think that RigidBody_A is an array of rigid bodies and Marker_A is an array of markers, which is untrue. Forgive me if this is a common convention.

I might suggest something like

RigidBody_A -> Pose_t Marker_A -> Marker_t

while RigidBody_t and RigidBody_M can stay the same.

content.raw:
yes, The OptitrackBridge class is not necessary because NPTrackingTools streams the data for you too.

We still need the `windows/optitrackBridge.cc` but is going to be really simple now.
content.html:
yes, The OptitrackBridge class is not necessary because NPTrackingTools streams the data for you too.

We still need the windows/optitrackBridge.cc but is going to be really simple now.
